column4: How can I grep the contents of every file on my entire system for the string "moobackup.sh" ?

hmm didn't find what I was looking for. I started a cron job over a year ago and i'm not sure where to find it. I'm migrating to a new system and would like to carry that task over. the script that is run is moobackup.sh . I can't find it listed in crontab or cron.weekly (as it runs every friday). Anywhere else I can search?
not in either. Would it matter if I was running ubuntu 5.10?
it might mean some things are in a different location... how about trying this:
just some other references to MOO stuff i have on the box. but nothing cron/task related.
back when I set this up, i do recall having to fiddle with the 0 * * 1 stuff though. So I know its cron related.
well, if the fine had that name you suggested, that find command should locate the script
Is it a system task or a user one?
go into /etc/cron.* directories and check all contents for something that looks familiar
read the contents of the files to locate the job
if it was a system task or a user task, would that change things?
